metadata.title: CVE-2017-18249 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The add_free_nid function in fs/f2fs/node.c in the Linux kernel before 4.12does not properly track an allocated nid, which allows local users to causea denial of service (race condition) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via concurrent threads.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18249` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1106-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1106.114
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1110.115
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1079-aws - 4.4.0-1079.89
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1043-kvm - 4.4.0-1043.49
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-145.171').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
